response.answer_text: Yes, the QR code standard is open and free. Many websites offer free QR code generation. Also, I have seen information that says credit should be posted to Denso Wave, the inventor. But that is not always done. Also, some companies offer enhanced QR codes - say for design enhancements or custom animations - which one does have to pay more for. Such firms include Visualead, and Animated Codes Made Easy.

Yes. The ISO 18004 standard describing QR Code is what is called a public domain standard— everbody is free to use it. That means anybody is free make, print or read a QR code without any restriction or royalties. You can use QR codes any way you want!
Yep. And they are super easy to generate. Just do a google search. This is the one that I use. But there are 1000’s of sites that do the same thing.
